Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech and debate, which have historically led to societal advancements.
The definition of 'harm' in the legislation is too broad and could encompass anything, leading to potential abuse.
Past instances of censorship during the pandemic labeled as misinformation were later proven true, causing unnecessary suffering.
The government is exempt from being accused of misinformation, despite spreading it during the pandemic.
Decisions on misinformation related to contested issues like climate change should not be left to a few individuals at ACMA.
Main Themes: Broad Definitions and Potential for Abuse
Notable Quotes: I am extremely (actually can I say scared to live in a country that would even consider such a bill).
When you look at history and some of the best advances that have been made for society it is because we had freedom of speech and debate.
The definition of harm is so wide it could include anything, this is really scary.
During the pandemic often it was Government who were spreading misinformation.
It seems to me we are not learning from our mistakes ie the pandemic where this type of censorship occurred with disastrous results.
